alert.note: Alert for Scott (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 20 at 4:11PM CDT until April 20 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN SCOTT AND SOUTHEASTERN MORGAN COUNTIES... At 410 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles west of Murrayville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Murrayville around 415 PM CDT. Woodson around 420 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Franklin, Alexander and Waverly. This includes Interstate 72 between mile markers 57 and 79. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
